div.l: Whils thou hast as a coward ben a gast
Ye fals harlot / ꝙquod the myller hast
A fals Clerk / fals traytour ꝙquod he
Thou shalt be ded / bi goddys dignyte
Who durst be so bolde / to disparage
My douhtir that is come / of suche lynage
And bi the throte bolle / he cauht Aleyn̄
And he him hent / dispitously agayn̄
And on the nose he smot hym wᵗyth his fest
Doıı̄un ran the bloody streme / vppon his brest
And in the floor / wyth nose and mouth to broke
The walwed / as to pygges in a poke
And vp thei gon / and doıı̄un a geyn̄ a non̄
Tyl that the myller͗e / spurned at a stoon̄
And doıı̄un he fyl bakward / on his wyf
That wyst nothyng / of this nyce stryf
For she was fall a slepe / a lytel wyht
Wyth Iohn the clerk / that waked al the nyht
And wyth that falle / out of hir sleep she brayd
Help holy cros of bramholm / she said
In manus tuas / lord to the y calle
A wake symond / the fynd is on vs falle
Myn hert is brokyn̄ / helpe y am but ded
Ther lyth oon vp on myn wombe and vp myn hed
Helpe symkyn̄ / for the false clerkys fyht
This Iohn stert vp / as fast as euyr he myht
And grasped / bi the walles too and fro
To fynd a staf and she stert vp also
And knew thestris / bet than did this Iohn
And bi the wall / a staf she fond a noon̄
